layout.title: Records
layout.message: Renders Custom Tables records (catalog) according to the selected layout.

fieldset.name: PARAMS
fieldset.label: Table & Layouts
fieldset.description: Basic menu item parameters needed to render the page.

field.name: establename
field.label: Table
field.description: Select the Table for reading the records. You can create a new table in Components/Custom Tables/Tables.

field.name: escataloglayout
field.label: Page Layout
field.description: Select Catalog Page Layout. This parameter is available on Custom Tables - Records menu item type.

field.name: esitemlayout
field.label: Item Layout
field.description: Item Layout. This parameter can be used on Records menu item and if Page layout type is Catalog Page not Simple Catalog.

field.name: eseditlayout
field.label: Edit Layout
field.description: Select Edit Form Layout. This parameter is available on most of the Custom Tables menu item types because the edit form can be opened from the Records (catalog) page, or even as the modal form.

field.name: esdetailslayout
field.label: Details Layout
field.description: Select Record Details Layout. This parameter is available on Record Details and Records menu item type pages.

fieldset.name: FILTERS
fieldset.label: COM_MENUS_FILTERS_FIELDSET_LABEL
fieldset.description: Filter or 'where clause' is used to extract only those records that fulfill a specified condition.

field.name: filter
field.label: Search Parameter
field.description: Field to search in = (or < or <= or > or >= or != and == 'exact match') value (or Twig tag as {{ user.id }} for example ) to have more then one condition use 'and', 'or' to get a value from the URL query parameter use {{ url.getint('param_name') }} tag or equivalent. Example 'color={{ url.getstring('string') }}' this will read value 'color' from the url query. To get the current date use {{ 'now'|date('m/d/Y') }} or {{ 'now'|date('Y') }} for the year or {{ 'now'|date('m') }} for the month. Also you can format the date using MySql date_format() format specifiers, example 1: {now:%m}. Example 2: 'birthdate:%m%d' to get the month and the day of the field value.

field.name: showpublished
field.label: Show published records
field.description: Additional filter to show published or unpublished records.

field.name: useridfield
field.label: Author user id field.
field.description: The 'User' type field name - checks if a record belongs to the current user. The table must contain the user type field. There is the option to find out if a record belongs to the current user through parent tables. Syntax example: 'user or parents(children).user'. In this case, there will be two checks: first, it will check if the record belongs to the current user, and then it will check if the record belongs to any parent record that belongs to the current user. At least one check must be positive.

field.name: recordstable
field.label: User Join Table
field.description: Table that contains record's user ids

field.name: recordsuseridfield
field.label: User Join User ID Field
field.description: Field that contains user id

field.name: recordsfield
field.label: User Join Field
field.description: Field that contains record's user ids

field.name: groupby
field.label: Group By
field.description: Field name to group results by.

field.name: limit
field.label: Limit clause - the number of records per page.
field.description: The LIMIT clause is useful on large tables with thousands of records. Returning a large number of records can impact performance. 0 means to not limit - to show all the records.

fieldset.name: SORTBY
fieldset.label: Sort By (Order By)
fieldset.description: Sort By parameter is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order. The ORDER BY keyword sorts the records in ascending order by default. To sort the records in descending order, use the `desc` keyword.

field.name: sortby
field.label: Default sort by field
field.description: Enter the field name to sort by and select ascending or descending order. Example 1: 'title desc' where 'title' is the field name and 'desc' is the keyword to set the descending order (z-a) Example 2: `title asc`. Note that the keyword `asc` is not necessary. Example 3: `title`. This can be overridden in the font-end using the Order By select box - {{ html.orderby }} tag.

field.name: forcesortby
field.label: Forced sort by field
field.description: Same as Sort By but cannot be overridden in the font-end.

fieldset.name: ctpermissions
fieldset.label: COM_CUSTOMTABLES_CATEGORIES_PERMISSION
fieldset.description: Specify what is allowed for selected user group.

field.name: guestcanaddnew
field.label: Guest can add new records
field.description: Public user group, logged out or unregistered users can add new records. This is useful for contact forms. Use {{ html.captcha }} tag to stop the spam.
field.option: Only registered can add new records

field.name: addusergroups
field.label: Who may add records
field.description: Select the user group that may add the records.

field.name: editusergroups
field.label: Who may edit records
field.description: Select the user group that may edit records.

field.name: publishusergroups
field.label: Who may publish records (Admin)
field.description: Select the user group that may publish and unpublish records.

field.name: deleteusergroups
field.label: Who may delete records
field.description: Select the user group that may delete records.

field.name: publishstatus
field.label: Default Publish Status
field.description: Publish status set to new records

fieldset.name: SaveRecordAction
fieldset.label: Save Action
fieldset.description: What to do when a new record is added or when record was edited.

field.name: returnto
field.label: Custom Return To
field.description: Visitor will be redirected to this link after record added or saved. This field may contain Twig tags and even record field values. Example: {{ fieldname }} to get the field value.

field.name: msgitemissaved
field.label: Record Saved Message
field.description: This message will appear above the content (Joomla notification message box) after record is saved or added.

fieldset.name: email
fieldset.label: Email Notification
fieldset.description: Send email(s) after record has been added or edited.

field.name: onrecordaddsendemaillayout
field.label: Email message Layout
field.description: Select the Email Message type layout to create the message body.

field.name: onrecordaddsendemail
field.label: The condition when to send the email
field.description: The contact forms, for example will have to be sent when the website visitor adds the record, not every time administrator edits it - changing the published status counts as editing.

field.name: sendemailcondition
field.label: Send Email Conditions
field.description: Example (That's PHP syntax): 'approved=1 or name==Mark'

field.name: onrecordaddsendemailto
field.label: Record added - send the email to

field.name: onrecordsavesendemailto
field.label: Record saved - send the email to
field.description: Same like above. The email will be sent when the record is saved, not added. This is useful for contact forms. The email can be sent to both emails if 'On Conditions (Works on refresh too)' selected.

field.name: emailsentstatusfield
field.label: The field where to save the Email Sent Status (1/0)
field.description: Field Name where to save the email sent status. Should be int or checkbox type. 1- sent, 0- not sent.

fieldset.name: Advanced
fieldset.label: Advanced
fieldset.description: Advanced settings, post processing and other.

field.name: allowcontentplugins
field.label: Allow Content Plugins
field.description: Let content plugins parse output content.

field.name: requiredlabel
field.label: Required Label
field.description: Character or a text to show next to required field if there is one.

fieldset.name: SHOPPING_CART
fieldset.label: Shopping Cart
fieldset.description: Parameters related to Shopping Cart functionality - available on Records menu item type page.

field.name: showcartitemsonly
field.label: Shopping Cart Only
field.description: Show Items in the Shopping Cart Only

field.name: cart_returnto
field.label: Cart Updated Return To
field.description: The link where to redirect after shopping cart has been updated.

field.name: cart_msgitemadded
field.label: Message: Cart: Item Added
field.description: Notification box message text to show when after an item has been added to the shopping cart.

field.name: cart_msgitemdeleted
field.label: Message: Cart: Item Deleted
field.description: Notification box message text to show when after an item has been deleted from the shopping cart.

field.name: cart_msgitemupdated
field.label: Message: Cart: Updated
field.description: Notification box message text to show when after the shopping cart has been updated.
